project.name: GLM Dashboard Explainer
project.description: Interactive pedagogical tool for teaching Generalised Linear Models

documentation.external: maintain claude.md as source of truth

outputValidation.rule: ALWAYS validate regression model outputs against actual R and Python sessions before including in tutorials
process: 1. Write R code and run in actual R session to get real outputs
2. Write Python code and run in actual Python session to get real outputs
3. Compare coefficients, standard errors, and fit statistics between implementations
4. Only include validated outputs in tutorial HTML files
5. Document any discrepancies (e.g., MLE vs unbiased variance estimator)
outputValidation.rationale: Illustrative/placeholder outputs can contain errors. Real outputs ensure tutorial accuracy and build trust with learners.

coefficientConsistency.rule: ALWAYS ensure coefficient values are IDENTICAL across all pages of a single tutorial
process: 1. Define the canonical coefficient values in tutorial-series.md BEFORE building pages
2. When any page mentions a coefficient (context panel, equations, interpretations), use the EXACT validated value
3. Cross-check all pages before committing to ensure no coefficient drift
4. If coefficients appear in multiple formats (e.g., β₁ = -0.83 and '0.8 bpm decrease'), ensure they match
commonErrors: Using rounded values on some pages but precise values on others
Copy-pasting placeholder coefficients that don't match final validated outputs
Interpreting coefficients with wrong sign or magnitude
coefficientConsistency.rationale: Inconsistent coefficients across pages confuse learners and undermine trust in the tutorial.

tutorialDevelopment.rule: Follow the 6-page template structure for all tutorials
